Yggdrasil laughs as Jayde is caught unaware.

Yggdrasil: Sorry, lady! It was too tempting! How could I sell him out?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> "Ah, the Maximal High Command's nothing but a bunch of morons - 
> YAAAAAH!" Jayde's flippant response turns into a startled yell as 
> Torin grabs her from behind and pulls her off the table, pinning her 
> arms to her sides as she struggles.  "Hey lemmego ya big bully!"
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > Yggdrasil, taking note of Torin's incoming joke, keeps facing 
Jayde.
> > 
> > Yggdrasil: Whaddaya mean? If only Maximal High Command allowed us 
> to 
> > download the newest software instead of that crappy Windows 98, I 
> know 
> > my game wouldn't have crashed!
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > Jayde is none the wiser, scrambling up onto the table itself for 
> a 
> > > better view.  "I've heard that one come out of a lot of mouths. 
 
> > This 
> > > gizmo should have been scrap metal by now."  She lays out on her 
> > side 
> > > invitingly with her head propped up on an elbow, knowing that 
> this 
> > > Maximal can't reach her.  Since she's facing Yggdrasil, she 
> doesn't 
> > > realize that Torin has crept into the room.  The lizard-bot puts 
> a 
> > > finger to his metallic lips, indicating for Yggdrasil to ingore 
> him. 
> >  
> > > This would appear to be the Rogue equivalent of a practical joke 
> > > taking shape.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > Quickly, Yggdrasil brought the solitaire game back up.
> > > > 
> > > > Yggdrasil: Look at this slaggin' crap! The computer beat me on 
> > that 
> > > > game! I just can't understand of this slaggin' nutbolt of a 
> > program 
> > > > beat me! If I could only scrap it, ya betcha I would!
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > "You say something, sweetie?" Jayde sticks her head into the 
> > > room.  
> > > > > This is quickly followed by the rest of her - all three feet 
> of 
> > > it.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > > Yggdrasil's long range sensors pick up a familiar spark 
> > > signature 
> > > > > > crashing down on the planet. He closes his solitaire game 
> and 
> > > > > brings 
> > > > > > up the spark's owner's data.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Yggdrasil: No... How can...
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > Then he suddenly shut up as he realizes he is still a 
> > prisoner. 
> > > He 
> > > > > > looks around to see if any of the Rogue heard him.
